steps.reasoning: The user wants to know the best value groceries they can get with $25. The find_budget_items tool is perfect for this as it will find budget-friendly items within a price range and prioritize discount stores and sale items.

data.esql:
FROM grocery_items
| LOOKUP JOIN store_inventory ON item_id
| WHERE stock_status != "out_of_stock"
| EVAL final_price = CASE(on_sale, sale_price, current_price)
| WHERE final_price <= 25
| LOOKUP JOIN store_locations ON store_id
| EVAL discount_score = CASE(
    chain_tier == "Discount", 3,
    on_sale, 2,
    1
  )
| STATS 
    best_price = MIN(final_price),
    avg_price = AVG(final_price),
    stores_count = COUNT_DISTINCT(store_id),
    max_discount_score = MAX(discount_score)
  BY item_id, name, brand, category, unit_size, organic
| EVAL value_score = max_discount_score + (100 / best_price)
| SORT value_score DESC, best_price ASC
| LIMIT 15

    max_discount_score = MAX(discount_score)
  BY item_id, name, brand, category, unit_size, organic
| EVAL value_score = max_discount_score + (100 / best_price)
